page.title: 14ECOLOGY -RIVER ROTHER AREA
page.content: We studied the River Rother which is one of the most polluted rivers in England. We found little or no water life and the river had been used as a dumping ground for unwanted junk.A large flash or lake,caused by mining subsidence, is nearby.This is a haven for wild birds particularly the grebe and heron. Water skiers share this site causing some noise pollution and irritation with local inhabitants.A small number of houses, over 90 years old,are situated near the flash.The people enjoy living here because of the rural aspect.The area is used by occasional ramblers,bird watchers and fishermen.Very little agriculture is possible because of the poor soil. Much of the surrounding area is a waste industrial tip.
